intro: Commelina pallidispatha, commonly known as the white-veined spiderwort, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Commelinaceae family, which includes many ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant features slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves with prominent white veins. Its flowers are small, clustered in inflorescences, and typically have three petals with a distinctive blue or purple coloration. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
